text: Ellsworth Kelly (May 31, 1923 - December 27, 2015) was an American painter, sculptor, and printmaker. He worked with hard-edge painting, Color Field painting and the minimalist school. His works showed unique techniques showing simplicity of form, similar to the work of John McLaughlin and Kenneth Noland. Kelly died in Spencertown, New York on December 27, 2015 of respiratory failure at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American painters Category:Artists from New York (state) Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Disease-related deaths in New York (state) Category:Gay men Category:LGBT artists Category:LGBT people from New York (state) Category:People from Newburgh, New York
title: Ellsworth Kelly
